metadata.dc:author: Torres Suárez, E
Sendagorta Gomendio, A
Ancochea Díaz, G
Sánchez-Waisen Hernández, F
Valdés González, J J
metadata.dc:description: CASE REPORT We report the case of a 66-year-old patient with serpiginous-like choroiditis and terminal epidermoid lung carcinoma. DISCUSSION Serpiginous choroiditis is an idiopathic disease, although similar lesions have been described in association with tuberculosis, sarcoidosis, systemic lymphoma, herpes virus infection and Crohn's disease. The coexistence of serpiginous-like choroiditis and a lung carcinoma has not previously been described.
metadata.dc:title: Coroiditis serpinginosa en paciente con carcinoma pulmonar.
[Serpiginous choroiditis in a patient with lung carcinoma].
metadata.dc:publisher: Archivos de la Sociedad Espanola de Oftalmologia
